medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The prostate cancer was diagnosed incidentally when an elevated PSA level of 5.3 ng/mL was found during a workup for erectile dysfunction. This followed a previous PSA value of 3.0 ng/mL recorded a year earlier. Two months after the biopsy, the PSA level was 4.5 ng/mL, indicating an inconsistent rate of change.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of gastric ulcer due to NSAID use, paroxysmal atrial fibrillation (remote), intermittent sinusitis, hyperlipidemia, and depression. Urological history includes nocturia once a night and previous inguinal herniorrhaphy and hydrocelectomy two years ago.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of prostate cancer.
medical_history.social_history: History of tobacco use from ages 13 to 23. Drinks alcohol daily (1 to 2 glasses of wine or hard liquor). Works full-time as a researcher and lives with his second wife, with two adult children.
